intro: Goniophlebium ceteraccinum, commonly known as the slender moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and small, closely arranged leaves that are typically green to yellowish in color. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, often clustered stalks. Goniophlebium ceteraccinum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
